DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Z dimension size of an OME tagged image file format (TIFF) file, a third dimension typically the depth, measured in pixels.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: OME Tagged Image File Format Z-Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tagged image file format (TIFF) image file format that contains an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) XML metadata block in the file header for storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata) using the OME Data Model._The magnitude of something in a third direction, generally representing depth.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Open Microscopy Environment Tagged Image File Format
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tagged image file format (TIFF) image file format that contains an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) XML metadata block in the file header for storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata) using the OME Data Model.

Concepts.longName: Open Microscopy Environment Tagged Image File Format
Concepts.definition: A tagged image file format (TIFF) image file format that contains an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) XML metadata block in the file header for storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata) using the OME Data Model.

Property.preferredDefinition: The magnitude of something in a third direction, generally representing depth.

Concepts.definition: The magnitude of something in a third direction, generally representing depth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/25/22 jk apprvd by SME, released for SRRS imaging data set. 9/16/21 jk HTAN Level 2 imaging data element, created for SRRS imaging data set.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of length in metric system equal to 10E-6 meter, or micrometer.

Concepts.definition: A unit of length in metric system equal to 10E-6 meter, or micrometer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
